intro: Luzula modesta, commonly known as the modest sedge, is a perennial herbaceous plant belonging to the family Cyperaceae. It is characterized by its grass-like appearance, with narrow, linear leaves and small, clustered flower heads. Native to temperate regions of the Northern Hemisphere, it thrives in moist, well-drained soils, often found in woodland or wetland habitats. The plant produces tiny, wind-pollinated flowers that develop into three-sided, three-lobed berries. Luzula modesta is valued for its ornamental appeal and ecological role in supporting local wildlife.
